functions.description: Adds a product to the system to be available for purchase

parameters.Description: "AddProduct"
The name of the product to be added
The id of the product group to add the product
The friendly name of the product. Will be generated if not supplied.
One of 'hostingaccount', 'reselleraccount', 'server' or 'other'
Set to true to enable stock control on the product
How much of this product is in stock
The payment type of the product. One of 'free', 'onetime', 'recurring'
Should the product be hidden from the client order form
Should the product show the domain registration options.
Does tax apply to the product.
Should the product be featured in the Product Group.
Is pro-rata billing enabled for this product.
The description of the product to show on the product listing in the cart
The short description of the product to show in specific areas of the cart.
The tagline of the product to show in specific areas of the cart.
The color to associate with the product in specific areas of the cart.
The id of the Email Template to use as the welcome email. Product/Service Messages only
See https://go.whmcs.com/1981/products#pricing
See https://go.whmcs.com/1981/products#pricing
A comma separated list of subdomains to offer on the domain register page. eg: .domain1.com,.domain2.com
When should the product be automatically setup. One of '' (never), 'on' (pending order), 'payment' (on payment), 'order' (on order)
The server module system name to associate with the product. eg: cpanel, autorelease, plesk
The server group id used on product creation to associate an appropriate server
The first module configuration value
The second module configuration value
The third module configuration value
The fourth module configuration value
The fifth module configuration value
The sixth module configuration value
The order to in which to display on the order form
The pricing array to associate with the product. Format: $pricing[currencyid][cycle]. See Example.
The recommendations array to associate with the product in the following format: ['id' => productid, 'order' => integer] (See example.)
Whether the product uses custom on-demand renewal settings.
Whether on-demand renewals are enabled for the product. Requires $ondemandrenewalconfigurationoverride be set to true.
The period (in days) during which clients can place early renewal orders for the monthly billing cycle. Requires $ondemandrenewalconfigurationoverride be set to true.
The period (in days) during which clients can place early renewal orders for the quarterly billing cycle. Requires $ondemandrenewalconfigurationoverride be set to true.
The period (in days) during which clients can place early renewal orders for the semi-annually billing cycle. Requires $ondemandrenewalconfigurationoverride be set to true.
The period (in days) during which clients can place early renewal orders for the annually billing cycle. Requires $ondemandrenewalconfigurationoverride be set to true.
The period (in days) during which clients can place early renewal orders for the biennially billing cycle. Requires $ondemandrenewalconfigurationoverride be set to true.
The period (in days) during which clients can place early renewal orders for the triennially billing cycle. Requires $ondemandrenewalconfigurationoverride be set to true.

functions.description:
This command can be used to validate an email address and password against a registered user in WHMCS.

If the email address is valid, and the password is correct, a session will be started as part of creating
a passwordhash. This session can be used for remote sign-in, (see below) but can affect other aspects of
your script if using the LocalAPI. A validated login will update the last login time stored for the
client account. On success, the `userid` and `passwordhash` will be returned. This can be used to establish
an authenticated session by setting the session key 'login_auth_tk' to the `passwordhash`.

Note: If session IP validation is enabled, this API call must be executed via the local API to receive
a valid hash.

Note: The login functionality provided by this API is superseded by
CreateSsoToken (https://developers.whmcs.com/api-reference/createssotoken/) for remote login
functionality and OpenID Connect (https://go.whmcs.com/1993/openid-connect) for authentication
services/credential verification. This API may be deprecated in the future given these more robust
and modern implementations.

parameters.Description: "ValidateLogin"
User Email Address
Password to validate

functions.description:
Create a single use, client or user single sign-on access token

Tokens are valid for a maximum of 60 seconds.

WARNING: The token returned provides _complete_ authentication to the associated
client account.  It is _imperative_ that scripts ensure the actor who
triggers this API call and receives this data has verified their identity and
ownership for the associated account.  IE, the invocation of this API
should be behind your own user authentication and account mapping engine.

NOTE: The associated endpoint where this token is redeemed is only for one-time
trusted tokens and will not attempt to enforce captcha or 2FA authorization
controls common to the WHMCS login form.

A valid destination is expressed using the short term like "clientarea:services".
Possible destinations are documented at https://go.whmcs.com/1989/single-sign-on-customization

parameters.Description: "CreateSsoToken"
The id of the client that should be authenticated by the resulting token
The id of the user that should be authenticated by the resulting token. If not provided, the owner of the requested client will be assumed.
A single valid destination. If not provided, the destination will be the clientarea homepage
The id of the service for respective clientarea $destination
The id of the service for respective clientarea $destination
Custom relative path for redirection after authentication when using sso:custom_redirect destination

functions.description:
Send a client Email Notification.

The following email templates cannot be sent in this way:

* Order Confirmation
* Password Reset Confirmation
* Password Reset Validation
* Quote Accepted
* Quote Accepted Notification
* Quote Delivery with PDF
* Clients Only Bounce Message
* Replies Only Bounce Message
* Affiliate Monthly Referrals Report

What you must provide for the Related ID depends upon the type of email being sent.
The available options are:

* General Email Type = Client ID (tblclients.id)
* Product Email Type = Service ID (tblhosting.id)
* Domain Email Type = Domain ID (tbldomains.id)
* Invoice Email Type = Invoice ID (tblinvoices.id)
* Support Email Type = Ticket ID (tbltickets.id)
* Affiliate Email Type = Affiliate ID (tblaffiliates.id)

**Sending Failed**

The generic Sending Failed error response can be caused by one of five possible conditions. They are:

* Invalid related ID
* Email template contains no body content after processing (typically a Smarty error)
* Welcome email requested for product which has none set
* Hook aborted the sending
* PHPMailer Sending Error - in this failure condition, an activity log entry will be created recording the error message that occurred

parameters.Description: "SendEmail"
The name of the client email template to send
The related id for the type of email template. Eg this should be the client id for a general type email
The type of custom email template to send ('general', 'product', 'domain', 'invoice', 'support', 'affiliate')
The HTML message body to send for a custom email
The subject to send for a custom email
The custom variables to provide to the email template. Can be used for existing and custom emails.

The first name of the client the quote is for if no $userid

The address1 of the client the quote is for if no $userid

The phone number of the client (no country code) the quote is for if no $userid. Local format eg 4035551234
The tax id of the client

The proposal text displayed to the end user

functions.description: Create or Update a TLD Extension. If a TLD exists, the existing record will be updated. If it does not, a new TLD will be created. Allows for configuration of TLD related selling parameters, pricing, grace periods and display order. Pricing can be supplied in any active currency and will be automatically converted into all active currencies within the WHMCS installation.

parameters.Description: "CreateOrUpdateTLD"
The extension to add or update eg: .com, .net, etc...
Offer ID Protection for the extension
Offer DNS Management for the extension
Offer Email Forwarding for the extension
Is an EPP required for domain transfers
The active registrar the extension should automatically register with on payment
Specify a group label. One of 'HOT', 'NEW' or 'SALE'. Leave blank for none.

The currency code the pricing is in. Required when defining pricing, grace fee, or redemption fee. Price will be converted for all active currencies. The currency must exist in the target WHMCS install and be configured with an exchange rate.
The number of days for the grace period
The grace period fee for the extension. -1 will disable the grace period
The number of days for the redemption period
The redemption period fee for the extension. -1 will disable the redemption period
An array of registration pricing. See example below for format.
An array of renewal pricing. See example below for format. The maximum renewal period for any extension is 9 years.
An array of transfer pricing. See example below for format. Only transfers for the minimum register period can be defined.
Can be used to modify TLD display order. Specify the existing TLD that this TLD should follow.

The payment method for the order in the system format. eg. paypal, mailin

The fifth nameserver to apply to all domains in the order

an array of base64 encoded serialized array of product configurable options values

Set to true to suppress the invoice generating for the whole order

an array of base64 encoded serialized array of TLD Specific Field Values
Add Email Forwarding to the Domain Order
Add ID Protection to the Domain Order

Override the price of the renewal price on the domain being ordered

An array of service IDs to be on-demand renewed

The date/time since to obtain the items. Format Y-m-d Can include H:i:s

functions.description: Adds a Billable Item

parameters.Description: "AddBillableItem"
The client to add the item to.
The description of the Billable Item. This will appear on the invoice.
The total amount to invoice for.
Either 'hours' or 'quantity'.
The number of units the billable items represents. Defaults to 0.
One of 'noinvoice', 'nextcron', 'nextinvoice', 'duedate', or 'recur'.
When `$invoiceaction=recur`. The frequency of the recurrence.
How often to recur the Billable Item. Days, Weeks, Months or Years.
How many times the Billable Item should create an invoice.
Date the invoice should be due (only required for due date and recur invoice actions). YYYY-mm-dd

functions.description:
Deletes a client.

Removes client record and all associated data. This action cannot be undone.

parameters.Description: "DeleteClient"
The client id to be deleted
Delete any users not associated with any other client.
Delete all transactions on this account

functions.description: Retrieve TLD pricing

parameters.Description: "GetTLDPricing"
The currency ID to fetch pricing for. Pass this or clientid, but not both. clientid overrides currencyid.
The client ID to fetch pricing for. Pass this or clientid, but not both. clientid overrides currencyid.

functions.description: Runs the module create action for a given service.

parameters.Description: "ModuleCreate"
The service ID to run the action for

functions.description: Trigger a Custom Notification Event.

parameters.Description: "TriggerNotificationEvent"
A unique identifier string, used as a condition when making a notification rule.
The title for the notification
The message body for the notification
The follow up URL for the notification
A status description for the notification
A formatting style for the status of the notification, currently supports "success", "danger", and "info"
An array of Attributes to include in the notification. Requires at least `label` and `value` parameters. Other parameters are optional. See WHMCS\Notification\NotificationAttribute.

functions.description: Attempt to capture a payment on an unpaid CC Invoice

parameters.Description: "CapturePayment"
The ID of the pending order
The CVV Number for the card being attempted

functions.description:
Close a Client.

This will close the client, cancel any invoices and set the status of all products to Cancelled or Terminated.

parameters.Description: "CloseClient"
The ID of the client to close

functions.description:
Deletes a task associated with a project

Removes a task from the system. This cannot be undone

parameters.Description: "DeleteProjectTask"
The project that owns the task being deleted
The task to be deleted

functions.description: Obtain the encrypted client password

parameters.Description: "GetClientPassword"
The userid to obtain the password for
The email address to obtain the password for

functions.description: Obtain quotes matching the passed criteria

parameters.Description: "GetQuotes"
The offset for the returned quote data (default: 0).
The number of records to return (default: 25).
A specific quote ID to find quotes for.
A specific client to find quotes for.
A specific subject to find quotes for.
A specific stage ('Draft','Delivered','On Hold','Accepted','Lost', or 'Dead') to find quotes for.
A specific created date to find quotes for. Format: Y-m-d
A specific last modified date to find quotes for. Format: Y-m-d
A specific valid until date to find quotes for. Format: Y-m-d

functions.description: Obtain the Activity Log that matches passed criteria

parameters.Description: "GetActivityLog"
The offset for the returned log data (default: 0)
The number of records to return (default: 25)
The ID of the client to obtain the log for.
The date of the activity log to retrieve in localised format (eg 01/01/2016)
The client email, user email, or admin username to retrieve the log entries for.
Search the log for a specific string
The IP Address to search the activity log for

functions.description: Adds a client.

parameters.Description: "AddClient"
The ID of the user that should own the client. Optional. When not provided, a new user will be created.
First name of the client to be created. Also used for the first name of the user when `owner_user_id` is not specified.
Last name of the client to be created. Also used for the last name of the user when `owner_user_id` is not specified.
Email address of the client to be created. Also used for the email of the user when `owner_user_id` is not specified.
2 character ISO country code.
The client's tax ID.
The password for the newly-created user account. Required when `owner_user_id` is not specified.
The ID of the security question in `tbladminsecurityquestions`. Required when `owner_user_id` is not specified.
The security question answer for a newly-created user.
Currency ID from `tblcurrencies`.
Client Group ID from `tblclientgroups`.
Base64 encoded serialized array of custom field values.
Default language setting. Also used for the language of the user when `owner_user_id` is not specified. Provide the full name: 'english', 'french', etc....
The originating IP address for the request.
Admin only notes.
Whether the client should opt-in to receiving marketing emails.
Whether to send the client a welcome email. A true value will not send the email.
Whether to enforce required fields. A true value will not enforce required fields. This does not apply to `email` and `password2` when `owner_user_id` is not specified.
~~Credit card type. Provide full name: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, etc....~~
~~Credit card number.~~
~~Format: MMYY.~~
~~Format: MMYY (if applicable).~~
~~Credit card issue number (if applicable).~~
~~Credit card CVV number (will not be stored).~~

functions.description: Obtain transactions matching the passed criteria

Obtain transactions for a specific invoice id

Find transactions for a specific transaction id

The offset for the returned affiliate data (default: 0)

Provide affiliates that match a specific visitor count
Provide affiliates matching the paytype provided. One of '', 'percentage', 'fixedamount'
Provide affiliates matching a specific overridden payout amount
Provide affiliates configured to receive one time affiliates
Provide affiliates that have this balance
Provide affiliates that have withdrawn this amount
